uk.ac.man.jb.pct.data
Interface I_InputPattern

All Known Implementing Classes:
InputPattern
public interface I_InputPattern

I_InputPattern is an interface that defines the operations to be applied to input patterns read in from input files.

Author:
Rob Lyon

Nested Class Summary
static class I_InputPattern.DataType
          The different types of data an input pattern may contain.

Method Detail

getClassMembership

java.lang.String getClassMembership()
Returns:
The name of the class an input pattern belongs to, if known. Else null.

getData

double[] getData()
Returns:
The raw data that forms an input pattern.

getData

double[] getData(int[] indexes)
Returns:
The raw data at the specified indexes .

getName

java.lang.String getName()
Returns:
a unique identifier for an input pattern.

getDataLength

int getDataLength()
Returns:
The length of the data array, or zero if the array is empty.

setData

void setData(double[] d)
Sets the data that forms an input pattern.

Parameters:
d - the raw data.

setName

void setName(java.lang.String n)
Sets the unique name of an input pattern.

Parameters:
n - the unique name.

setClassMembership

void setClassMembership(java.lang.String c)
Sets the name of the class that this input pattern belongs to. For instance if this input pattern represents a binary pulsar, this would be its class.

Parameters:
c - the name of the class.

getScoreCount

int getScoreCount()
Returns a count of the number of objects that forms an input pattern. The number of objects corresponds to the number of attributes that forms this input pattern.

Returns:
0 if there are no attributes, else the number of attributes.

isClassMember

boolean isClassMember()
Tests to see if an input pattern belongs to a class. Returns true if the pattern does belong to a class, else false if the class is not known.

Returns:
true if the class is known, else false.
